module.name: Relay Board 01
module.description: The relay board offers up to 8 digital inputs, controlling up to 8 relays or controlling up to 4 shutters.

reg.name: Enable/Disable button
reg.description:
Enable or disable a button. There are up to 8 buttons enumerated by 1 to 8. The button 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the button and a 1 enables it.
Any change in this register will be applied immediately.

reg.name: Enable/Disable wind measurement
reg.description:
Enable or disable the wind measurement. A 0 disables the wind measurement and a 1 enables it. Note, that if the wind measurement is enabled, the button 8 functionality will be disabled.
Any change in this register will be applied immediately.

reg.name: Enable/Disable relay
reg.description:
Enable or disable a relay. There are up to 8 relays enumerated by 1 to 8. The relay 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the relay and a 1 enables it. Please note, that if a shutter is enabled, it doesn't matter that the relays are disabled here.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

reg.name: Enable/Disable shutter
reg.description:
Enable or disable a shutter. There are up to 4 shutter enumerated by 1 to 4. The shutter 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the shutter and a 1 enables it. If a shutter is enabled, the used relays can not be controlled by single relay actions!
Bit 0: Enable shutter 1 and disable relay 1 and 2 to be controlled external. Bit 1: Enable shutter 2 and disable relay 3 and 4 to be controlled external. Bit 2: Enable shutter 3 and disable relay 5 and 6 to be controlled external. Bit 3: Enable shutter 4 and disable relay 7 and 8 to be controlled external.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

reg.name: Relay event config
reg.description:
Enable or disable a releay event. There are up to 8 relay enumerated by 1 to 8. The relay 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the event and a 1 enables it.
Any change in this register will be applied immediately.

reg.name: Shutter event config
reg.description:
Enable or disable a shutter event. There are up to 4 shutter enumerated by 1 to 4. The shutter 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the event and a 1 enables it. Note, that the shutter must be enabled.
Any change in this register will be applied after immediately.

reg.name: Relay switching current duty cycle (MSB)
reg.description:
A monostable relay is configured by a switching current and a holding current. Both values are given as a pwm duty cycle value (3-400).
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

reg.name: Relay switching current duty cycle (LSB)
reg.description:
A monostable relay is configured by a switching current and a holding current. Both values are given as a pwm duty cycle value (3-400).
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

reg.name: Relay holding current duty cycle (MSB)
reg.description:
A monostable relay is configured by a switching current and a holding current. Both values are given as a pwm duty cycle value (3-400).
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

reg.name: Relay holding current duty cycle (LSB)
reg.description:
A monostable relay is configured by a switching current and a holding current. Both values are given as a pwm duty cycle value (3-400).
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: oaddr
reg.description: Originating address: Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0x00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set, oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: flags
reg.description: Flags: Set selection behaviour. The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited. The zone and sub-zone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/sub-zone information of an event. The zone/sub-zone must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Sub-zone match
bit.description: If set to one, sub-zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one, zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address must be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class mask (low 8 bits)
reg.description: The lowest 8 bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row. Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class filter (low 8 bits)
reg.description: The lowest 8 bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row. Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: oaddr
reg.description: Originating address: Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0x00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set, oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: flags
reg.description: Flags: Set selection behaviour. The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited. The zone and sub-zone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/sub-zone information of an event. The zone/sub-zone must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the 9th bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Sub-zone match
bit.description: If set to one, sub-zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one, zone must match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address must be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one, the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Class mask (low 8 bits)
reg.description: The lowest 8 bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row. Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Class filter (low 8 bits)
reg.description: The lowest 8 bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row. Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.name: Log id (stream id)
reg.description: The log id (stream id) is used for debugging purposes. If you want to enable the log message stream, start logging (CLASS1.Log.LogStart) with this log id.

reg.name: Transport transmit errors
reg.description: Current number of transmit errors, counted in the VSCP-framework transport layer. The error counter is reset after reading.

abstraction.name: Enable/Disable button
abstraction.description:
Enable or disable a button. There are up to 8 buttons enumerated by 1 to 8. The button 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the button and a 1 enables it.
Any change in this register will be applied immediately.

abstraction.name: Enable/Disable wind measurement
abstraction.description:
Enable or disable the wind measurement. A 0 disables the wind measurement and a 1 enables it. Note, that if the wind measurement is enabled, the button 8 functionality will be disabled.
Any change in this register will be applied immediately.

abstraction.name: Enable/Disable relay
abstraction.description:
Enable or disable a relay. There are up to 8 relays enumerated by 1 to 8. The relay 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the relay and a 1 enables it. Please note, that if a shutter is enabled, it doesn't matter that the relays are disabled here.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Enable/Disable shutter
abstraction.description:
Enable or disable a shutter. There are up to 4 shutter enumerated by 1 to 4. The shutter 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the shutter and a 1 enables it. If a shutter is enabled, the used relays can not be controlled by single relay actions!
Bit 0: Enable shutter 1 and disable relay 1 and 2 to be controlled external. Bit 1: Enable shutter 2 and disable relay 3 and 4 to be controlled external. Bit 2: Enable shutter 3 and disable relay 5 and 6 to be controlled external. Bit 3: Enable shutter 4 and disable relay 7 and 8 to be controlled external.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Relay event config
abstraction.description:
Enable or disable a releay event. There are up to 8 relay enumerated by 1 to 8. The relay 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the event and a 1 enables it.
Any change in this register will be applied immediately.

abstraction.name: Shutter event config
abstraction.description:
Enable or disable a shutter event. There are up to 4 shutter enumerated by 1 to 4. The shutter 1 corresponds to bit 0 and etc. A 0 disables the event and a 1 enables it. Note, that the shutter must be enabled.
Any change in this register will be applied immediately.

abstraction.name: Relay switching current duty cycle
abstraction.description:
A monostable relay is configured by a switching current and a holding current. Both values are given as a pwm duty cycle value (3-400).
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Relay holding current duty cycle
abstraction.description:
A monostable relay is configured by a holding current and a holding current. Both values are given as a pwm duty cycle value (3-400).
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 1 max. up time
abstraction.description:
Max. up-time (drive time from bottom to top) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 2 max. up time
abstraction.description:
Max. up-time (drive time from bottom to top) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 3 max. up time
abstraction.description:
Max. up-time (drive time from bottom to top) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 4 max. up time
abstraction.description:
Max. up-time (drive time from bottom to top) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 1 max. down time
abstraction.description:
Max. down-time (drive time from top to bottom) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 2 max. down time
abstraction.description:
Max. down-time (drive time from top to bottom) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 3 max. down time
abstraction.description:
Max. down-time (drive time from top to bottom) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 4 max. down time
abstraction.description:
Max. down-time (drive time from top to bottom) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 1 turn time
abstraction.description:
Max. turn-time (turn 90°) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 2 turn time
abstraction.description:
Max. turn-time (turn 90°) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 3 turn time
abstraction.description:
Max. turn-time (turn 90°) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Shutter 4 turn time
abstraction.description:
Max. turn-time (turn 90°) in 0.1s as 16-bit value.
Any change in this register will be applied after a reset.

abstraction.name: Log id (stream id)
abstraction.description: The log id (stream id) is used for debugging purposes. If you want to enable the log message stream, start logging (CLASS1.Log.LogStart) with this log id.

abstraction.name: Transport transmit errors
abstraction.description: Current number of transmit errors, counted in the VSCP-framework transport layer. The error counter is reset after reading.

action.name: Enable relay
action.description: Enable one or more relay by bitmask.

param.name: Relay bit mask
param.description: A 1 enables a relay, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Relay bit mask
data.description: A 1 enables a relay, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Disable relay
action.description: Disable one or more relay by bitmask.

param.name: Relay bit mask
param.description: A 1 disables a relay, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Relay bit mask
data.description: A 1 disables a relay, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Toggle relay
action.description: Toggle one or more relay by bitmask.

param.name: Relay bit mask
param.description: A 1 toggles a relay, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Relay bit mask
data.description: A 1 toggles a relay, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Stop shutter
action.description: Stops one or more shutter by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 stops a shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 disables a shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Drive shutter up
action.description: Drives one or more shutter up by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 drives a shutter up, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 drives a shutter up, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Drive shutter down
action.description: Drives one or more shutter down by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 drives a shutter down, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 drives a shutter down, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Drive shutter to top
action.description: Drives one or more shutter to the top by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 drives a shutter to the top, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 drives a shutter to the top, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Drive shutter to bottom

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 drives a shutter to the bottom, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 drives a shutter to the bottom, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Drive shutter for calibration
action.description: Drives one or more shutter by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 calibrates a shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 calibrates a shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Alert shutter
action.description: Alerts one ore more shutter by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 alerts a shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 alerts a shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Remove shutter alert
action.description: Remove alert from one ore more shutter by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 removes the shutter alert, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 removes the shutter alert, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Drive shutter to shade position
action.description: Drives one ore more shutter to shade position by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 drives the shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 drives the shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

action.name: Turn shutter (jalousie)
action.description: Turns one ore more shutter by bitmask.

param.name: Shutter bit mask
param.description: A 1 turns the shutter, a 0 doesn't care.

data.name: Shutter bit mask
data.description: A 1 turns the shutter, a 0 doesn't care.
